results.title: Development of speed
results.brief_description: Traces the development of style and speed in swimming through the ages. The movement of animals a bas-relief produced in 9 BC, and the crawl stroke as it has become recognized in the 20th century are studied. Details of the quick starting, racing diving, and quick turning for three well known strokes - back stroke, breast stroke, and crawl - are demonstrated.
results.description: Traces the development of style and speed in swimming through the ages. results.title: Development of movement themes in the gymnasium (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Swift Film Productions and Margaret Rosewarne
results.brief_description: Students demonstrate the basic movements used in comparatively advanced educational gymnastics. In four parts - balance, elevation, use of apparatus, and advanced examples. Aims to encourage inventiveness and resourcefulness, and illustrates body tension, transition, and group rhythms.

results.title: Development of feelings in children
results.creator_credit: Parents' Magazine Films and Donald Connors
results.brief_description: Describes and illustrates how the child develops feelings, stressing that the child must be allowed to express his/her feelings freely, particularly feelings of fear, anger and hate. Aims to make parents aware of the distinction between feelings and actions, and suggests ways that parents can aid the healthy emotional development of their child.

results.title: Development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, CRM Productions and Bruce Hart
results.brief_description: This film examines the stages of growth from birth to adolescence, introducing the concept of human psychological development. Accompanied by a song written and performed by Donovan and another written by Graham Nash and performed by Crosby, stills, Nash and Young.

results.title: Developing more and better ideas
results.brief_description: A down-to-earth presentation of the process of developing ideas to help everyone, from top management to lowest rate employee, produce more and better ideas for cutting costs, increasing productivity, developing products and improving quality and performance.

results.title: Developing leadership
results.brief_description: Discusses those traits of character which contribute to a boy’s capacity as a leader. The film is centred around a story in which a boy responds to an emergency and proves himself to be a leader by his enthusiasm, by his vision and imagination, and by his readiness to accept responsibility.

results.title: Devastation
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and National Films Council of the Motion Picture Industry
results.brief_description: A plea for the planting of trees throughout Australia to offset damage by bush fires and thoughtless timber cutters. Shows how tree destruction results in soil erosion, floods and water shortage but also how government planting of trees and voluntary planting by community groups can alleviate the problem.

results.title: Deutsch Direkt! Eps. 11-20
results.brief_description: This second set of video programs in the German language course continues to build on the vocabulary of the first ten programs, whilst introducing new vocabulary. Each program also includes a look at a different aspect of life in Germany or Austria. Introduced by Hanni Vanhaiden. A workbook and audio-cassettes are also available for use with the videos.
